Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

  

Interested in joining a team like ours, in the Strategy & Digital Transformation function?

  

The Strategy and Digital Transformation management team drives the Volvo Group’s digital agenda by aligning business strategy, technology and organizational capabilities. We support the Volvo Group CDO in setting the strategic direction for Digital & IT, transforming how we work and enhancing our organization capabilities, to drive the Digital & IT community forward. We orchestrate the development of outcome driven plans, aligned with strategic goals, and steer the execution of strategic programs. We build key relationships with external partners, that enables sustainable value creation across the Group.  

With expertise in digital strategy, transformation management, and emerging technologies, together, we ensure that Volvo Group remains at the forefront of digital evolution - responsive, resilient, and future-ready. We like to be ahead of the curve, tackling complex challenges with curiosity, creativity, and a shared purpose.  

Our diverse team thrives on collaboration, bringing energy to every transformation initiative. We believe in making room for learning and laughter along the way, ensuring that our journey is as rewarding as our destination, with a focus on long-term impact for the Volvo Group  

We are looking for several talented individuals to join our team, so if you are eager to be part of a diverse, fun and highly ambitious team, then we may well be a good match.

 **Who are you?**

  

You may bring experience and strengths such as:

* Leading Change and Transformation: Experience guiding large-scale strategic initiatives, with a practical and hands-on mindset when it comes to bringing strategy to life.
* Program Management Know-How: A solid foundation in program management, with a growth mindset—learning from past experiences and using them to continuously improve.
* Strategic Facilitation Skills: Confidence in facilitating discussions at the executive level, with the ability to simplify complexity and help teams move quickly toward solutions.
* Storytelling with Impact: A talent for crafting compelling and insightful stories that connect ideas to action—especially when communicating with executive audiences.
* Engaging Communication: Comfort presenting to senior stakeholders, with a style that builds trust and encourages collaboration.
* Industry Awareness: An understanding of the Volvo Group is welcome, and experience in digital-first organizations is a great bonus.
* Business-Driven Thinking: An ability to see the bigger picture and connect business needs with Digital & IT goals in meaningful ways.
 **What’s in it for you**

  

Joining our Strategy and Digital Transformation function brings exposure to the entire Volvo Group, working with our colleagues to ensure that our Digital & IT organization is well connected to the outcomes our business has set out to achieve. You will be instrumental in making change happen – for real. Working for the Volvo Group you will be part of not only a digital transformation journey but be in a company leading the transport industry transformation.  

And for us? It means working with a talented individual like yourself, in a team that thrives on diverse views and experiences so that we can build the world we want to live in. Together.

  

Does this opportunity spark your interest? Don't wait to apply! We are conducting interviews continuously, and we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.

title: Solution Consultant IT Senior
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**SAP EWM Senior Functional Consultant in Supply & Distribute Internal Logistics**
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


We are looking for a highly experienced SAP EWM Senior Functional Consultant to join our newly created team. The ideal candidate will have deep functional knowledge of S/4HANA Embedded EWM, strong integration experience, and a proven track record in template building, greenfield and brownfield implementations, and global rollouts.

**Key Responsibilities:**
-------------------------

* Support in the implementation & rollout of SAP EWM global template solution for one of the largest Automotive manufacturing companies in the world.
* Support greenfield and brownfield SAP S/4HANA EWM implementations across multiple regions and business units.
* Support end-to-end project lifecycles, from Functional documentation, development of EWM objects & testing to go-live and hyper-care support.
* Ensure seamless integration across modules – PP, MM, SD, and SAP Digital Manufacturing (DM).
* Develop and manage EWM-MES integrations, including custom and standard interfaces with non-SAP systems (e.g., PLC-driven systems, third-party WMS).
* Design and support RF Framework for handheld and mobile operations, including queue management, custom screens, and RF menu enhancements.
* Push for use of standard and custom Fiori apps for different EWM processes – inbound/outbound, internal, packing activities and production supply.
* Work on middleware integration: IDOCs, Proxies, Web Services, and API-based communication.
* Collaborate with technical teams on IDOCs, Proxies, BADIs, and Function Modules.
* Ensure system reliability, data accuracy, and real-time visibility across warehousing and production operations.
* Utilize Azure DevOps for project tracking, release management.
* Track and resolve incidents via ServiceNow, with ownership of root cause analysis and knowledge transfers.
* Provide expert-level support and training to key business stakeholders and end users.
**Technical Skills & Expertise:**
---------------------------------

* Strong functional and technical expertise in ASR, API, and warehouse/production integration.
* Should have knowledge of production integration and preferably Digital manufacturing.
* Good to have knowledge of Advanced Shipping & receiving.
* Proven experience building custom EWM templates and executing rollouts across multiple sites.
* Deep hands-on experience in RF Framework configuration and enhancement.
* Fiori app extension/customization and role-based UI optimization.
* Integration with non-SAP systems (via IDOCs, RFCs, proxies, APIs, middleware like PI/PO or CPI).
* Familiar with development lifecycle using Azure DevOps and incident/change handling in ServiceNow.
* Comfortable in collaborating with ABAP developers, BASIS, infrastructure, and business teams.
**Preferred Qualifications:**
-----------------------------

* SAP Certifications in SAP EWM.
* Experience with automotive manufacturing systems such as MES, RFID/barcode scanners, and warehouse automation.
* Familiar with Azure DevOps and ServiceNow for project and support lifecycle.
* Excellent soft skills – communication, problem-solving, and collaboration.

 **Want to know more?**

  



Feel free to contact Hiring Manager Liza Tollmén, liza.tollmen@volvo.com

  

Last application date is 2025-05-11

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

title: Cloud Solution Architect Internship Opportunities
description:
Come build community, explore your passions and do your best work at Microsoft with thousands of University interns from every corner of the world. This opportunity will allow you to bring your aspirations, talent, potential—and excitement for the journey ahead.
   

  

 As a Cloud Solution Architect Intern, you will provide technical expertise through sales presentations, product demonstrations, installation and maintenance of company products. Assists the sales staff in assessing potential application of company products to meet customer needs and preparing detailed product specifications for the development and implementation of customer applications/solutions.
   

  

 At Microsoft, Interns work on real-world projects in collaboration with teams across the world, while having fun along the way. You’ll be empowered to build community, explore your passions and achieve your goals. This is your chance to bring your solutions and ideas to life while working on cutting-edge technology.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Start date: September 2025**
**Type of Employment: Internship**
* Applies foundational technical knowledge of an architecture solution to meet business and information technology (IT) requirements and resolve identified technical constraints.
* Acts as the voice of the customer (VOC)/partner by learning to identify and share feedback around technical capabilities, blockers, and insights that relate to the customer/partner with internal team.
* Solicits input from others to contribute to proposals for viable solutions based on specific technical products. Demonstrates basic technical concepts and proves those design solutions capability through design collaboration sessions with the customer/partner.
* Participates in discussions around architecture design, resiliency reviews, and technical optimization that result in production deployment application and increase customer/partner usage, consumption, and value outcomes. Leverages development opportunities (e.g., mentorships, role-based resources, trainings, internal events such as Ready, Build, Ignite) to learn new technologies or services.


**Qualifications**
**Required/Minimum Qualifications**
* Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business or related field
* You must be legally authorised to work in Sweden to be eligible for this role. (Legally authorised = has citizenship or has been granted a valid visa or work permit)
* Fluent in both English and Swedish


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Passion for technology and customer obsessed
* Displays strong stakeholder and relationship management across senior leaders, partners, and customers. Excellent verbal and written communication, analytical and presentationskills
* Technical Certification in Cloud (e.g. Azure, Amazon Web Services, Google, security certifications)
* Change Management Certification (e.g. Prosci)


 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Cloud Solution Architect
description:
Come build community, explore your passions and do your best work at Microsoft. This opportunity will allow you to bring your aspirations, talent, potential and excitement for the journey ahead.
   

  

 As Cloud Solution Architect, you will gather customer/partner insights and leverages these insights to design architectures, provide expertise/guidance and develop Microsoft solutions to achieve customer/partner business outcomes and drive to completion the resolution/unblocking of their issues, resulting in accelerated consumption. This opportunity will allow you to leverage knowledge of the products, services, and value propositions of Microsoft and its competitors in customer/partner conversations to identify growth opportunities.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* You will act as the voice of the customer (VOC)/partner by learning to identify and share feedback around technical capabilities, blockers and insights that relate to the customer/partner with internal teams.
* You will demonstrate basic technical concepts and prove those design solutions' capability through design collaboration sessions with the customer/partner and support customer skilling needs by participating in discussions on technical delivery with other internal and external stakeholders to transfer knowledge and contribute to customer readiness.
* With supervision, you will identify issues and advises customers/partners to operate and optimize performance in accordance with Microsoft best practices and apply methodology and governance, as directed, to minimize business and technical risks and adhere to quality assurance while ensuring excellence in contributions to design and/or delivery of solutions.
* You will learn about the products, services, and value propositions of Microsoft's Cloud and support businesses and share learnings with others (e.g., peer groups, customers) as appropriate and assess customer/partner needs and gather information that helps others to identify growth opportunities.
* You will learn to identify and communicate areas in intellectual property (IP) that need refreshing or have gaps and contribute to IP development with guidance/supervision.
* You will leverage development opportunities (e.g., mentorships, role-based resources, training courses, internal events such as Ready, Build, Ignite) to learn new technologies or services.
* You will embody our culture and values.


**Qualifications**
**Required Qualifications**
* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND 1+ year(s) work or internship experience involving cloud/infrastructure technologies, information technology (IT) consulting/support, systems administration, network operations, software development/support, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting
* OR equivalent experience
* Fluent in both English and Swedish


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Bachelor's Degree (or currently pursuing) in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND 2+ years experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, information technology (IT) consulting/support, systems administration, network operations, software development/support, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting
* OR equivalent experience
* Technical Certification in Cloud (e.g., Azure, Amazon Web Services, Google, security certifications)


 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. title: Global Head of Digital Solutions
description:
**About our opportunity:**
 Are you excited about the prospect of transforming the way people work through innovative digital solutions? Do you have a passion for creating seamless, intuitive experiences that empower leaders and employees alike?
   

  

 Reporting to the Chief People Officer and serving on the Group Function People Leadership Team, this role will architect and execute a digital HR strategy that enables our people to do their best work, every day, everywhere. This leader will ensure our digital platforms are intuitive, impactful, and drive measurable business value worldwide.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Develop and implement a digital HR systems roadmap and strategy that aligns with and supports the Ericsson Human Resources Strategy.
* Collaborate closely with global HR leaders and business stakeholders to understand needs and drive innovation in digital solutions.
* Ensure seamless integration and optimization of HRM, CRM, ERP, and other enterprise platforms, partnering closely with IT and external vendors.
* Champion the creation of an exceptional end-to-end employee experience through cutting-edge People technology solutions.
* Challenge the status quo with confidence, proposing and trying out completely different approaches to drive impactful change.
* Drive large-scale change projects, ensuring successful implementation and adoption across the organization.
* Persuade and influence C-suite executives, gaining their support and alignment for transformative digital initiatives.
* Utilize design thinking and agile methodologies to deliver impactful digital solutions that address business needs.
* Stay ahead of digitalization trends and evolving technology solutions to optimize impact and drive change.
* Build and develop a team of subject matter experts dedicated to delivering outstanding digital solutions.


**What you will bring:**
* Deep leadership experience in either HR digital transformation or related IT fields, in large complex organisations.
* You will drive innovation, with a user centric mindset and strategic thinking.
* Knowledge of HR technologies (cloud platforms, people analytics, automation, AI) and ability to evaluate, implement, and optimize digital tools.
* Proven track record in leading digital infrastructure, architecture, and technology roadmaps.
* Strong understanding of digitalization and how technology solutions can enhance employee experience and business impact.
* Exceptional leadership skills aligned to Ericsson’s leadership principles to create clarity, develop people and drive results.
* Excellent communication & listening skills to understand how to optimally execute People processes such as recruitment, succession planning, performance evaluation etc.
* Ability to work effectively both independently and collaboratively within a diverse, global organization with complex priorities.
* Experience as a change agent, with a creative and forward-thinking approach to decision-making.
* Ability to navigate and integrate diverse cultural perspectives, ensuring digital solutions are effective and inclusive across geographies


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Stockhom, Sweden.

title: Director, Emerging Enterprise
description:
SLSQ426R246
   

  

**Do you want to help solve the world's toughest problems with big data and AI? This is what we do every day at Databricks!**
 Leading a team of Emerging Enterprise & Digital Native Account Executives, you will be measured by achieving your team's overall quota and growing Databricks consumption. You will be expected to both expand existing business and land new strategic logos, whilst delivering accurate sales forecasting and reporting. As a senior leader in the Nordic region, you will be responsible for defining the sales strategy and sponsoring cross-functional initiatives.
   

  

 This is a fantastic opportunity to build upon a highly successful team achieving significant year on year growth, in a high growth business which is a hugely impactful part of the EMEA sales organisation. We are looking for owners, who will go the extra mile and want to be the very best at what they do.
   

  

 This position reports directly to the RVP, Emerging Enterprise.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Have**
* Lead a team of account executives, ensuring you coach them to develop the skills and behaviours they will need to succeed
* Establish company territory plans, team structure, individual quotas and patches for your team, including investment capacity requirements
* Report on revenue forecast and strategic GTM programs
* Partner with cross-functional teams to manage a complete revenue and customer success process
* Inspire a culture of teamwork, leading with value and achieving desired customers outcomes
* Develop trust-based relationships with customers and partners to ensure long-term success
* Encourage learning and ongoing understanding of technical product details and our future product roadmap
* Establish a revenue growth and investment plan in the first 90 days
* Deliver our strategic growth plans, in collaboration with the other function leaders across EMEA, ensure forecast accuracy and a predictable, high-growth business


**What We Look For**
* Experience as a high-growth enterprise software sales leader with experience leading sales teams serving Digital Native and Mid-Market / Commercial customers in the Nordics within the Data, AI, Cloud, or SaaS Sales Industry
* Passionate about hiring, coaching and developing talent with a proven track record of this
* History of exceeding sales quotas in similar high-growth technology companies
* Focus and emphasis on methodology-based sales coaching, MEDDPIC and value-based sales with both the business and IT stakeholders including C suite
* Knowledge of the partner ecosystem to help grow enhance approaches to territories
* Success implementing strategies for consumption and commitment-based sales revenue models
* Business travel is required outside Sweden.
* Fluent Swedish is high preferable and business English language required.


**About Databricks**
 Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.
   

  

**Benefits**
 At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.
   

  

**Compliance**
**If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.**

title: Architect
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Job Description**
* Lead the enterprise onboarding of Power Automate, ensuring a structured, scalable, and secure adoption process.
* Develop governance framework, policies, and best practices to enable teams to build automation solutions responsibly.
* Ensure compliance with security and regulatory requirements, collaborating with IT security and compliance teams.
* Create and deliver enablement programs (training, guidelines, and support structures) to empower business and IT teams to develop their own automation solutions.
* Advise on architectural best practices to ensure automation solutions are scalable, maintainable, and aligned with business goals.
* Work with leadership and key stakeholders to define automation strategies, prioritize use cases, and establish governance boards.
* Facilitate the integration of Power Automate with enterprise systems, ensuring a seamless user experience and operational efficiency.
* Provide expert guidance on Copilot Studio adoption, ensuring AI-driven automation aligns with enterprise needs.


**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Extensive experience leading Power Automate enablement or enterprise automation initiatives.
* Relevant Microsoft certifications (e.g., Power Platform Solution Architect, Security, Compliance & Identity)
* Strong knowledge of governance, security, and compliance frameworks related to Power Platform.
* Experience working in highly regulated industries with a deep understanding of risk management.
* Knowledge of Microsoft 365 Copilot and its integration with enterprise workflows.
* Familiarity with Copilot Studio and AI-driven automation is a plu


**Application deadline:** 
 23-04-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Application Specialist Microsoft 365 till Matas Group
description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens digitala arbetsplats?
   

  

 Matas Group söker nu en erfaren och affärsdriven Application Specialist inom Microsoft 365.
   

  

 I denna roll får du möjlighet att arbeta strategiskt och operativt med att utveckla och optimera plattformen, samtidigt som du stödjer verksamheten i en pågående IT-transformation.
   

  

**Din vardag:**
 Som Application Specialist inom Microsoft 365 har du en nyckelroll i att säkerställa en effektiv och modern digital arbetsmiljö. Du arbetar nära verksamhetens olika avdelningar för att identifiera behov, driva förbättringsinitiativ och utveckla användningen av M365-plattformen. En central del av rollen är att skapa utbildningsmaterial och vägleda organisationen i att nyttja systemets fulla potential.
   

  

 Du ansvarar för administration, konfiguration och vidareutveckling av tjänster som Exchange, SharePoint, Teams och OneDrive. Du hanterar avancerad support på 2nd och 3rd line-nivå samt har en aktiv dialog med Microsoft och andra leverantörer för att bevaka och implementera nya funktioner.
   

  

 Vidare deltar du i strategiska projekt för att forma en sammanhållen svensk-dansk IT-miljö, där du ges stort eget ansvar att driva utvecklingen framåt.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi ser gärna att du har teknisk förståelse för Microsoft 365 och en stark affärsmässig förmåga. Du trivs i en rådgivande roll där du kan omsätta tekniska möjligheter till värdeskapande lösningar för verksamheten.
   

  

 Som person är du analytisk, proaktiv och har ett strukturerat arbetssätt. Din kommunikationsförmåga gör att du kan hantera både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter på ett pedagogiskt sätt.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:**
* Gedigen erfarenhet från en liknande roll gärna inom Microsoft 365-administration och utveckling
* Djup teknisk kunskap om M365-tjänster (Exchange, SharePoint, Teams, OneDrive) och deras administration
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla och implementera digitala arbetssätt och processer
* Förmåga att skapa tydlig och strukturerad dokumentation för både tekniska och icke-tekniska målgrupper
* Erfarenhet av att hålla utbildningar och vägleda verksamheten i tekniska förändringar
* Starkt affärsdriv och vana att arbeta i en organisation under förändring
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och fatta beslut baserade på analys och verksamhetsförståelse
* Strukturerat helhetsperspektiv med förmåga att hantera både strategi och detaljnivå
* Flytande engelska och svenska, samt god förståelse för nordiska språk


**Om Matas Group**
 Matas Group är en nordisk ledare inom skönhet och välbefinnande med en omsättning på över 7,6 miljarder DKK, 500+ butiker, 4 000+ anställda, 5+ miljoner lojalitetsmedlemmar och webbshoppar i Danmark, Sverige, Norge och Finland.
   

  

 Matas Group driver två detaljhandelskedjor i Norden: Matas i Danmark och KICKS i Sverige, Norge och Finland. Företaget erbjuder ett brett utbud av externa varumärken, egna varumärken samt en stark fokus på hög service, personlig rådgivning och expertis.
   

  

 Matas Group är noterat på Nasdaq OMX Köpenhamn.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Matas Group med Wise IT. Vill du veta mer, kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Sandra Åhs på sandra.ahs@wiseit.se.
   

  

 Vi kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökningar via mail då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.
   

  

 Vi hanterar alla ansökningar löpande och även så urvalet av kandidater som går vidare till intervju.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Affärsutvecklare Strategiska Projekt till PostNord Sverige
description:
Dygnet runt är vi på väg - från en människa till en annan, från ett företag till ett annat. Varje dag levererar vi över 4,5 miljoner brev och 600 000 paket. Varje försändelse är viktig - post, paket och logistik möjliggör relationer och affärer. Här får du vara med och påverka!
   

  

**Du & Vi & Jobbet**
 Du kommer att ingå i ett kompetent och engagerat team inom Affärsområde Logistik. Vi är på en transformationsresa i en snabbt föränderlig marknad, vilket skapar möjligheter både i rollen och för din framtida karriär. Du rapporterar till Chef affärsutveckling Logistik och utgår från PostNords fina huvudkontor Arken i Solna.
   

  

**Vad du kommer att göra**
 PostNord söker nu en driven och erfaren medarbetare för att leda och genomföra uppdrag inom affärsutveckling, förändringsledning, organisationsutveckling och transformation. I denna viktiga roll får du möjlighet att påverka PostNords framtida riktning genom att identifiera förbättringspotential, skapa strategier och genomföra förändringar på lång sikt.
   

  

**Du kommer b.la att arbeta med**
* Affärsutveckling och förändringsledning Leda och genomföra affärsutvecklings- och transformationsprojekt, från analys till implementering. Du kommer att identifiera områden med förbättringspotential och utveckla skräddarsydda strategier och handlingsplaner för att driva positiv förändring i verksamheten.
* Kundfokuserad lösningsutveckling Bidra till vårt affärs- och marknadsarbete genom att identifiera kundernas utmaningar och utveckla innovativa lösningar som stärker våra erbjudanden och kundrelationer.
* Projektledning och problemlösning Strukturera och planera komplexa projekt, leda projektteam med olika kompetenser, och säkerställa att projektmålen uppnås inom givna tidsramar och budget.
* Styrgruppsarbete och resursplanering Driva styrgruppsarbete, planera projektresurser och prognostisera projektomkostnader. Du kommer även att ta fram investeringskalkyler och följa upp effekter samt genomföra efterkalkyler och arbete med lessons learned.
* Strategiskt partnerskap och teknologiska lösningar Utvärdera potentiella strategiska partners för att ta fram innovativ teknologi, produkter och tjänster som kan driva utvecklingen framåt.


**Vad du tar med dig**
* Akademisk examen inom ekonomi, logistik, teknik/IT eller motsvarande.
* Gedigen erfarenhet som managementkonsult, business analyst eller i en strategisk roll med dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda och genomföra transformations- och förändringsprogram.


**Din profil**
 Vi ser att du har gedigen erfarenhet av att hantera många stakeholders och rapportera till senior management, samt har arbetat i komplexa matrisorganisationer. Du är en strategisk och naturlig ledare med förmåga att styra projekt i en dynamisk miljö.
   

  

 Du har en bakgrund inom supply chain, sälj eller teknik, vilket gör att du har god förståelse för affärs- och operativa processer. Din analytiska förmåga gör att du kan omvandla data och insikter till konkreta strategier och handlingsplaner.
   

  

 Du har mycket goda kunskaper i Officepaketet vilket gör att du effektivt kan hantera projektplanering, analys och rapportering.
   

  

 För att lyckas och trivas i rollen är du prestigelös och relationsskapande, med en förmåga att bygga långsiktiga och effektiva samarbeten både internt och externt. Du trivs med att arbeta nära kunder och leverantörer, och har förmågan att driva framgång i komplexa sammanhang genom ett handfast och tryggt ledarskap. Lösningsorienterad och analytisk, ser du snabbt samband och utvecklingsmöjligheter, samtidigt som du är flexibel och trivs i en internationell och föränderlig arbetsmiljö.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och ser fram emot att välkomna dig till vårt team!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Vi är ett modernt kundorienterat företag som tänker lika mycket på våra anställda som på våra kunder. Vi erbjuder en flexibel hybridarbetsplats. PostNord är en av Sveriges största arbetsplatser och erbjuder schyssta arbets- och tjänstepensionsvillkor, friskvårdsbidrag och personalförmåner genom vår egen personalstiftelse PostNord Plus. Hos oss finns det goda utvecklings- och karriärmöjligheter. Anställning sker enligt kollektivavtal.
   

  

**Varför vi finns** 
 PostNord är ett av Sveriges äldsta och största företag och vi har ett viktigt samhällsuppdrag, att säkerställa postservice till företag och privatpersoner i hela Sverige. Vi är i en ständig transformation och arbetar konsekvent med att utveckla både vårt erbjudande och våra medarbetare. Som den ledande leverantören av kommunikationslösningar till, från och inom Sverige förenklar vi vardagen för människor. Hos oss arbetar människor med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter och du blir en del av en arbetsplats som aktivt arbetar med mångfald. Vi är PostNord - ett fantastiskt företag att jobba och växa med. Läs mer på postnord.se.
   

  

**Ansök**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar PostNord med Jefferson Wells. Tjänsten söker du via länken nedan. För mer information är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Sofia Huhta på 08-452 33 69 alternativt på sofia.huhta@jeffersonwells.se
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Solution Architect (SharePoint, Power Platform,Power BI, Azure)
Engineering Team Lead, Merchant Payouts
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We have an exciting opportunity for an engineering team lead to join our ranks building a bigger and better Wolt. We’re currently on the lookout for an Engineering Team Lead, to join our Merchant Payouts team.
   

  

 The Fintech group as a whole consists of 12 different teams, building financial services used by our Couriers, Merchants and Customers. Those financial services cover a wide range of functionalities, including various payment methods, Invoicing, Anti-Money Laundering processes, Payouts, Cash advances and User Interfaces for a varying group of users who manage all things finance.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 As an Engineering Team Lead, you’ll ensure we do the right things in the right way, acting as a facilitator and striving to make the complex things simple. You’ll see it as your biggest mission to cultivate personal growth of your team members and serve as a servant leader by truly getting to know each team member, having regular 1on1s with feedback, and facilitating goal-setting.
   

  

 You’ll also act as an enabler for the daily and weekly practices and do whatever is needed to help the team succeed. As we work in a highly ownership-driven environment, it will often mean taking a step back and giving autonomy to the team, engaging with stakeholders and partners; on other occasions, you may contribute hands-on if you want and give your guidance
   

  

 You ensure world class engineering practices and raise ambition level while working in a sustainable way in a psychologically safe environment. We’d expect you to know well when to apply which approach.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
* You know what it takes to develop top-quality software, take care of people and achieve ambitious goals together.
* You come with previous experience in a highly regulated environment, preferably within the FinTech domain.
* You'll be an inspirer, facilitator and enabler for the team to do what they do best by making personal development plans, hosting regular 1on1s and taking part in recruitment.
* You're not afraid to step into action when needed, and most of the time, you are also ready to step back and let the team do its magic.
* We expect you to be a good communicator, willing to serve people outside of your team and liaise with senior stakeholders.
* You’re a product-oriented and proactive problem solver willing to bring up issues in a constructive manner to the team and the whole Wolt Product team.
* The essential tasks in this role are facilitation, communication, helping high performing engineers to focus and bringing them context. But if you are one of those unicorns with leadership abilities & development skills, there could be room for hands-on contribution as well!
* Our teams work with e.g. Kotlin, Go, TypeScript, React, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Kafka, GitHub Actions, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, DataDog, Looker so we also value skills with any of these.


 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Vice President of Engineering
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Computer and Network Security
description:
Meet
 
 Yubico
 
 : the inventor of the
 
 YubiKey
 
 ––the world's first and leading security key. Our company’s mission is to make secure login easy and available for everyone. Yubico was founded in 2007 by Stina and Jakob Ehrensvard, and recently went public on Nasdaq Stockholm Main Market: YUBICO. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies, hundreds of government agencies and millions of individuals in over 160 countries that rely on Yubico technology to secure access to computers, online services and mobile apps. We  are a global company with a strong company culture and employees located in over 14 countries. Yubico’s  headquarters are based in  Stockholm, Sweden and Santa Clara, CA.  Aligned with our mission to make the internet more secure for everyone, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations helping at-risk individuals through our philanthropic initiative,
 
 Secure it Forward
 
 .
 








**At Yubico, we offer:**








**Yubico Values:
 
 We work to ensure that our employees have an open space to have their voices amplified to create a workplace where everyone feels like they belong. Aligned with this, our employees have created some pretty cool Employee Resource Groups: YubiPride, YubiBIPOC, YubiSustainability and YubiWomen. Additionally, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations in need all over the world (you can read more about our work here).
 





**Social Connection:**

 Relationships and connectedness matter, and we love spending time with our team! Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether it's through Yubico celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. We host an all-team event in a new location every year where we plan for upcoming quarters, set goals, and most importantly, host fun events to encourage team building outside of the workplace. Check out our
 

 Life at Yubico Page
 

 on LinkedIn and our awards
 

 here
 
**.**




  






 The Role:
 









 We are seeking a Vice President of Engineering to lead our engineering teams in hardware engineering, firmware development, tools, SDKs & applications development, and manufacturing in our Stockholm office. This executive role will be a key part of the leadership team, responsible for driving the technical vision and execution of Yubico’s engineering strategies, overseeing product development from design to manufacturing, and ensuring that Yubico’s products continue to meet the highest standards of security, performance, and reliability.
 









 The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in hardware and firmware engineering, along with exposure to manufacturing processes. You will be responsible for building, leading, and mentoring a high-performing engineering team while collaborating closely with other departments to ensure smooth product development and successful product launches.
 









  




**Tasks & Responsibilities:** 
* **Leadership & Team Management:** 
 Build, lead, and mentor Yubico’s engineering teams across hardware engineering, firmware development, and manufacturing. Cultivate a culture of innovation, collaboration, and excellence while ensuring continuous team growth and development
* **Technical Strategy & Vision:** 
 Define and drive the engineering strategy for hardware and firmware systems at Yubico, ensuring alignment with the overall product vision and business goals. Lead the execution of this strategy to create next-generation security products
* **Product Development & Execution:** 
 Oversee the end-to-end product development lifecycle, from initial concept and prototyping to mass production. Ensure all hardware and firmware products are delivered on time, meet security requirements, and exceed quality and reliability
* **Manufacturing & Supply Chain Management:** 
 Collaborate with the operations and manufacturing teams to ensure smooth and efficient production processes. Drive optimization of manufacturing workflows, quality control, and supply chain management to ensure high-quality products and scalability
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** 
 Work closely with product management, design, marketing, and sales teams to align engineering efforts with business objectives. Ensure that products meet market needs and user requirements, integrating feedback into future development cycles
* **Innovation & R&D:** 
 Foster a culture of innovation within the engineering team, ensuring that Yubico continues to lead the market with groundbreaking security technologies. Stay informed on industry trends and emerging technologies that can influence future product development
* **Security & Quality Assurance:** 
 Ensure that all engineering processes and products adhere to the highest standards of security, reliability, and performance. Implement and enforce best practices for hardware and firmware testing, verification, and validation
* **Process Optimization:** 
 Continuously evaluate and improve engineering processes, tools, and workflows to increase efficiency, reduce time-to-market, and support scalability. Promote best practices in hardware and firmware development to streamline development efforts
* **Customer Focus:** 
 Engage with customer-facing teams to understand user needs and pain points, ensuring that engineering solutions meet and exceed customer expectations. Leverage market insights to guide product improvements and new product initiatives



  




**Basic Qualifications:** 
* Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field
* Experience:
* 10+ years of experience in hardware and firmware engineering, with a proven ability to design and deliver complex, secure products at scale
* At least 5+ years in a leadership role, managing engineering teams, and collaborating cross-functionally to deliver successful hardware and firmware products
* Strong experience with manufacturing processes, including familiarity with hardware prototyping, assembly, quality control, and scaling production Knowledge of contract manufacturing and managing global supply chains is a plus
* Experience in secure hardware (e.g., smart cards, hardware security modules, encryption devices) and an understanding of security protocols (e.g., FIDO2, U2F, TLS) is highly desirable
* Experience with embedded firmware development (C, C++, low-level programming) and embedded systems
* Proven ability to drive end-to-end product development across hardware and firmware, from design and development to testing, deployment, and production
* Familiarity with hardware design tools (e.g., PCB design, schematic capture) and firmware development tools



  




**Technical Skills:** 
* Strong technical background in hardware engineering, with experience in electrical design, PCB layout, and signal integrity
* In-depth knowledge of embedded systems and firmware development, with the ability to integrate hardware and software components to deliver high-performance, secure products
* Familiarity with manufacturing techniques and processes for high-volume product production (e.g., SMT, PCBA, etc.)
* Understanding of cryptography and security protocols is a major advantage



  




**Leadership & Soft Skills:** 
* Strong leadership and management skills, with the ability to mentor and develop engineering talent while fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and accountability
* Exceptional communication skills, capable of presenting technical topics to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Strategic thinking and a strong business acumen, able to balance short-term product development goals with long-term technological growth and sustainability
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, managing multiple projects while maintaining high standards of quality and performance
* Agility to address rapid shifts in product development and technology needs while ensuring that team members feel heard and that decisions are made collaboratively and inclusively to promote a sense of unity
* Fluency in English is required; proficiency in Swedish is a plus






  




  














  





 We are an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity and uphold an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. We'd love to learn about what you can add to our diverse team.
 







 Yubico does not accept agency resumes or referrals so please do not send them to our careers staff or employees. Yubico is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes or referrals.
 







 Personal data submitted through this form is used for managing Yubico’s recruitment activities, which include facilitating any application you make, setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing results and selecting candidates, and as otherwise needed in our recruitment and onboarding processes. The use of your personal data may also be necessary prior to entering into a contract with you (that is prior to offering you a job with Yubico). Your personal data will only be used for the purposes for which it was collected and in accordance with the Yubico Privacy Notice. We only keep your personal data for as long as necessary and in compliance with Yubico’s record retention policies. If you have asked us to, we will keep you informed of other opportunities at Yubico. We do this in various ways, including email and by phone. If at any time you do not want us to contact you or use your information as described herein please contact us at jobs@yubico.com to let us know and we will delete all such information. Providing your personal data is voluntary, but necessary to join our talent community, and if you do not agree to provide your data, we will not be able to consider you as part of our talent community.
 







 As part of providing the requested service, we will transfer your data to be processed by Lever, Inc., a service provider contracted by Yubico AB and/or its subsidiaries that meets legally mandated privacy requirements. The Yubico Privacy Notice offers more information about Yubico privacy practices, including the lawful basis for processing of personal data, how to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority, and how to contact Yubico to exercise your data subject rights. In this notice, when we refer to "Yubico", "us", "we" or "our", we mean the Yubico group company or companies that you apply to, or correspond with, and which are responsible for any personal data collected about you.**

title: Sales Executive - New Business - PSO
description:
Meet Unit4, a fast-paced, game-changing SaaS company revolutionizing ERP for scale-ups, mid-market organizations, and category leaders. We’re not just rewriting the rules of enterprise software; we’re tearing up the old playbook. For 40 years, the ERP industry has been bogged down by clunky, legacy systems, and we’re here to shake things up.
   

  

 At Unit4, we’re all about transformation. We empower ambitious businesses with cutting-edge ERP solutions that are adaptive, intuitive, and self-driving—designed to free organizations from the mundane and help them focus on what truly matters. Our mission? To turn work into something more meaningful while helping our customers achieve their greatest potential. Want to learn more about how we’re reshaping the future? Head to our website and see how we’re helping businesses thrive.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 We’ve got an exciting opportunity, to join our high-energy, fast-growing sales team. If you’re a natural hunter, a born deal-closer, and someone who thrives in fast-paced environments, this is your chance to shine.
   

  

 As a New Business Sales Executive, you’ll play a critical role in driving digital transformation for scale-ups, mid-market organizations, and category leaders in the Professional Services sector. Your mission: sell Unit4’s ERP Financial and HCM solutions, win new logos, and help our clients unlock their true potential.
   

  





  

*This is a hybrid role based out of our Stockholm office.*




 What You’ll Do
   

  




* Craft and execute a killer new business sales strategy to hit ambitious targets in the Professional Services vertical.
* Qualify leads like a pro and engage key decision-makers with a consultative, value-driven approach.
* Own complex sales cycles from start to finish, orchestrating cross-functional teams—pre-sales, value engineering, marketing, and more—to close big deals.
* Deliver powerful, results-oriented presentations to C-level execs, focusing on their core challenges and the Office of the CFO.
* Help prospects see the business impact of our solutions, turning skeptics into believers.
* Stay ahead of the curve by mastering our tech and keeping up with industry trends


**Qualifications**
* You’re a go-getter with at least 3-5 years of experience selling complex SaaS solutions.
* You have a proven track record in ERP or financial SaaS sales (mandatory).
* You’re a pro at navigating the Professional Services sector and understand its unique needs.
* Business processes? You know them inside and out.
* You have the charisma to inspire, the resilience to negotiate, and the vision to guide clients toward success.
* You’re a team player with a hunter’s mindset, always looking for that next big win.
* You’re comfortable engaging and influencing C-level executives, turning tough challenges into bold opportunities.
* Mentorship, leadership, and collaboration come naturally to you—you’re always ready to lift others while driving results.


**Additional Information**

 Why Unit4?
   

  





  

 At Unit4, we believe in big ideas, bold action, and breaking barriers. Here’s what sets us apart:
   

  




* Freedom to Thrive: We trust you to own your role and drive success, offering autonomy and flexibility.
* Uncapped Time Off: Take the time you need to recharge—your well-being matters.
* Global Wellbeing Days: When we say “switch off,” we mean it. We all take time to prioritize health and balance.
* Next-Level Talent: Collaborate with some of the sharpest minds in the software industry.
* Purpose-Driven Impact: Be part of our Act4Good program, where innovation meets sustainability to make the world better.
* Inclusive Culture: We’re committed to diversity, equity, and belonging through our Employee Resource Groups like Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, and Mental Health & Access at Unit4.



 This is your chance to join a company that’s as ambitious as you are. If you’re ready to disrupt the status quo and make a real impact, let’s talk.
   

  

 Ready to take the leap? Apply now and let’s make work better, together.

title: Finance Expert, Product
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 As a Finance Development Manager, you will be at the forefront of Wolt’s financial strategy, ensuring robust financial process performance, operational efficiency, and financial data consistency. You will work closely with senior leadership and cross-functional teams to drive financial insights and support the company’s continued growth. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced finance professional who thrives in a fast-paced, innovative environment.
   

  

 As a Finance Development Manager at Wolt you work together with our Finance Process Owners, documenting, clarifying and communicating the finance requirements to the Product Development team for relevant projects in your portfolio. Your portfolio will consist of several different types of projects, but the main focus at the hire will be in revenue recognition and Wolt offerings to merchants. This means working closely with our Product Owners and developers working to improve and further develop our platform.
   

  

 What you'll be doing
   

  

* Support Finance Process Owners and other internal customers with issue scoping and making actionable plans to successfully implement development initiatives
* Partner with Product Owners to ensure finance requirements are considered on relevance in product development and act as a one-point of contact for the finance area towards Product development initiatives
* Manage and drive projects, as per need basis as a Project Manager in the finance core processes
* Identify and drive improvements and harmonization across financial processes, ensuring scalability and efficiency as Wolt expands
* Focus area in the beginning will be the Merchant offering, but the team portfolio is wide range
* Challenge the ways in which we are operating our finance processes and propose solutions for increasing our efficiency or quality and drive harmonized E2E processes
* Support ad-hoc financial projects, including for example expansion and new business initiatives


 Our humble expectations
   

  

* 5 + years of experience from relevant roles in Finance
* Experience from project management, preferably in the area of Finance core processes
* Proof points of processes end-to-end management
* Be comfortable with managing a broad set of stakeholders with efficient communication and with the ability to stand firm when needed
* Technical implementation experience and interest on finance systems and data flows
* Experience in a fast-growing or technology-driven company is highly desirable
* Exceptional problem solving skills and the ability to translate finance requirements into actionable Product development plans
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively across teams and with senior management
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities


 What you’ll get by joining us
   

  

* Opportunity to be part of building something exceptional, in an international environment
* Lots of learning and growth in a globally scaling tech company
* Competitive salary + long term incentive plan available


 Next steps
   

  

 If you are creative, like moving fast, and thrive in a dynamic environment where you get to be proactive and figure out what to do (rather than wait to be told) – then apply today!
   

  

 If you have any further questions about the position, you can turn to: Rafael Rosa, Talent Acquisition Partner - rafael.rosa@external.wolt.com.
   

  

 Please note that
 **we do not accept applications sent by mail** 
 . You should submit your application through our careers website!
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Risk Modelling and Actuarial Analyst
description:
Are you eager to kick-start your career at one of the world's leading advisory and audit firms? At PwC, we are driven by the use of our creativity, experience, and the latest technology to generate value for our clients. This drive is shared among everyone working with us, and together, we tackle complex challenges, foster business development, and have a positive impact on society. If you have the right mindset, we have thousands of opportunities for you to contribute to a better future.
   

  

**What value you bring as a Risk Modelling and Actuarial Analyst**
 As a Risk Modelling And Actuarial Analyst Within PwC, You Will Be Involved In Varying Types Of Client Projects And Topics, Such As
   

  

* Calculating, validating and reporting technical provisions and solvency capital for insurance and occupational pension companies.
* Valuation of insurance and occupational pension contracts and portfolios.
* Implementation of insurance-related regulations.
* Actuarial work within the areas of data analytics, digital and technology transformations and artificial intelligence.
* Risk modelling of diverse risks categories, including insurance risks, market risks, credit risk, cyber risks and climate risks.
* External and internal audit work.


 You will be part of our Financial Services Risk and Regulation department in Stockholm. Many of our projects are conducted through cross-competency teams with participants from various departments, allowing us to bring the right skills to our clients. Team members have the possibility to exchange knowledge and learn from each other, with an expectation to influence and contribute through their own experiences and skills to the project’s successful completion. In addition to working with local colleagues, you will also have regular contact with colleagues in our Nordic and international offices.
   

  

 Given the variety of projects and breadth of our business, we expect you to enjoy a fast learning curve. On a longer-term perspective, we offer numerous development paths within PwC, ranging from data and analytics work within other industries to secondment opportunities within our international network.
   

  

 We will support you in your efforts towards achieving an actuarial education and diploma.
   

  

**What are we looking for in this position?**
 As a person, you are analytical, driven, structured and curious. You have the capability and interest to quickly learn new things and adapt to new situations. Performing your work you do as a team player and with integrity. Your communication is straightforward and you have the ability to explain complex matters in an understandable way. You are service-minded, have good social skills and an ability to create relationships and networks.
   

  

 An academic background in mathematics and mathematical statistics or other relevant technical education is required. Further, you have experience of programming languages such as R or Python. Skills in Microsoft 365 are helpful. It is preferable if you have started an actuarial education and are committed to completing it. Knowledge of the insurance industry, its current and evolving regulations (such as Solvency 2, statutory accounting rules and IFRS 17) and financial modelling concepts is advantageous. Furthermore, it is preferable if you have prior experience from working with data analytics, artificial intelligence or machine learning.
   

  

 You have advanced language skills in both Swedish and English.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
 Welcome with your application to us no later than 31 May 2025. We will review applications continuously, and the position may be filled earlier than the application deadline.
   

  

**Please Attach The Following Documents To Your Application**
* CV
* Cover letter
* Academic grades from university/college


 We believe in having a recruitment process that applies to everyone. As part of the selection, we use psychometric tests to ensure an objective, unbiased, and fair selection.
   

  

 We value the personal meeting to understand the value you can bring to PwC and what we can offer you. The interview process usually consists of multiple stages and various types of interviews. When meeting with HR, you will have a competency-based interview where we examine the personality test you completed before the interview. During the interview with the business, you will have the opportunity to meet with the relevant team to discuss the role. We call for interviews continuously, and we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

title: Global Head of Offensive Security
description:
***Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats?
   

  

 We are looking for a Global Head of Offensive Security to team up with the most dedicated team of cyber specialists in our Offensive Security domain.***
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 350 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Global Head of Offensive Security who wants to make a difference in our Offensive Security Team.
   

  

**Offensive Security**
 Our offensive team works proactively, helping organizations and companies protect themselves against cyber breaches by identifying vulnerabilities before they are exploited. Our devoted team members work closely together, utilizing their combined knowledge and experience to successfully perform assignments such as penetration tests, security assessments, and red team engagements.
   

  

**The Role**
 As the Global Head of Offensive Security, you will lead and develop our Offensive Security team, ensuring we stay ahead in the fight against cybercrime. Your responsibilities include:
   

  

* Managing strategic customer relations, including negotiations and contracting.
* Coaching and supporting your international team of 20+ members.
* Helping the organization develop processes and routines for quality control and continued growth.
* Grow your business area in the countries following the global growth of Truesec group.
* Being a sounding board for both consultants and customers.
* Collaborating with recruiters to find grow the ranks of expert-level members for your team.
* Working with Business Development to create new services and offerings for our customers.
* Maintaining structure with deals, agreements, and procurement.


**Your Potential Background**
 We believe you have a background that includes extensive experience in offensive security and leadership from senior positions. Preferably, you have experience from a similar role within cybersecurity or at minimum within a technical IT organization.
   

  

**Required Skills:**
* Proven track record of leading high-performing teams in cybersecurity or similar areas.
* A good knowledge of tools, techniques, and methodologies used in offensive security.
* Excellent communication skills, both technical and non-technical.


**Bonus Skills:**
* Extensive experience in penetration testing and red teaming.
* Certifications such as OSCP, OSCE, or similar.
* Experience in public speaking or thought leadership in cybersecurity.
* Familiarity with defensive security measures and incident response.
* Experience in growth journeys, with entrepreneurial traits being a big plus.


 Above all, we believe you are just as passionate about cybersecurity as we are! Every day, we work with preventing intrusions and cybercrimes with the ultimate goal of making Sweden and the world safer. By joining forces with us at Truesec, you get to work with the best in the business to continue this mission!
   

  

***Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.***
**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Technical Writer
company_industry: Manufacturing, Motor Vehicle Manufacturing, and Industrial Machinery Manufacturing
description:
The client is currently expanding their capacity and capability for education in describing the embedded system and software in the Product Data Management work (PDM) Product Data Management (PLM) systems.
 



 They are now looking for an educator/ technical writer with IT business analyst competence or a business analyst with really good pedagogical and digital education competence. The audience will be global engineers in a very agile, changing environment.
 



  





**Scenario:** 




**Current solution:** 
 Fragmented education and way of working with documenting the customer product description (Embedded systems and software).
 



**New solution:** 
 Structured pedagogical workflows, instructions, education and trainings, partly. Supporting PDM support in a continuous pedagogic WoW and documenting
 



**Tasks:** 
 This role is expected to consolidate and create education material consistent of (workflows, technical documentation, instructions and/or step-by-step guides for IT-systems), hold classroom education sessions (theory) as well as training sessions (hands-on, where the users get to try out the theory). Continuously making technical complex issues understandable for a global audience, using modern agile solutions.
 



**Output:** 
 Documentation consisting of (workflows, instructions, technical documentation, educations), Classroom sessions ( Education & Trainings).
 



  





**Requirement:** 




 Education Master of Science, (other level of education is also acceptable if proven track record of work can match the education level), Scaled Agile Framework Language
 



 Swedish & English on a professional level (Swedish can be excluded if necessary). Meriting Embedded Software and Hardware development, Knowledge about
 



 - Product Data Management (PDM) Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) system
 



 - electrical system and/or embedded systems in vehicles.
 



  





**Ready for your next career move? Explore opportunities at** 

 Co-Workertech.com
 








**Join our LinkedIn groups for updates on upcoming opportunities! Connect, collaborate, and thrive with industry leaders :** 



* Co-Worker Technology
* Co-Worker Renewable Energy Industry Jobs







**Follow us to stay updated on the latest news, insights, and exciting announcements from our company.** 




 👉
 
 Facebook
 




 👉
 
 Instagram
 








**Let's stay connected and grow together! 🚀**

title: Är du vår nästa Analytics Consultant?
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Design Services
description:
Vi letar nu efter fler kollegor till vår växande grupp datakonsulter; personer som gillar att skapa värde genom data & analys!
   

  

 Våra närmare 100 dataexperter i Sverige jobbar med datalösningar inom nästan alla teknologier, både med och utan cloud. Ett vanligt projekt varierar i längd från en månad till några år, och situationen kan justeras baserat på dina önskemål. Våra kunder finns inom alla branscher, allt från produktutveckling, hälsa, industri och försäkring till kommunikation, bank och elförsörjning.
   

  

 Såhär beskriver vår Analytics konsult Alexandra sitt nuvarande projekt:
   

  

 “Jag hjälper kunden att utveckla en app för att följa upp kostnader i stora projekt, för att se till att man ligger i linje med budgeten och fakturerar enligt plan. Mitt uppdrag hos kunden kommer att breddas framöver då jag nyligen hjälpt till att göra en kartläggning av Power BI-behov i hela verksamheten. Vi har bland annat hittat behov inom kvalitet och hållbarhetsredovisning – vilket jag tycker är extra spännande då det knyter an till mitt intresse för området. Det bästa med uppdraget är samarbetet – jag är del av ett Scrum-team bestående av bolagets egna it-medarbetare och användare. Det är också tryggt att ha Solitas community i ryggen, jag vet att jag aldrig är ensam, det finns alltid hjälp att få av kollegorna”
   

  

**Känner du igen dig i följande?**
* Du diskuterar gärna datavisualiseringar och databaser, och bygger inspirerande dashboards
* Du kan implementera datalösningar som fungerar både för dataexperter och beslutsfattare på företag
* Du lär dig gärna nya teknologier och metoder
* Du har flera års erfarenhet att jobba med visualisering, gärna med Tableau, Power BI samt SQL eller Python
* Du är intresserad och nyfiken av teknologier och data


 Det viktigaste för oss är ändå att du delar våra värderingar, du är omtänksam mot andra och delar gärna din kunskap och vågar stå för det du tror på.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Vår företagskultur är väldigt viktig för oss, vi värdesätter låg hierarki, självständighet och ansvar, värdeskapande arbete och trevliga kollegor. Här kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, och här kan du bläddra bland våra tech-bloggar.
   

  

* Flexibilitet och autonomi för att utforma ditt arbete med flextider– läs mer från vår blogg.
* Ständig utveckling: Vi erbjuder kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling för att säkerställa att våra medarbetare ligger längst fram i teknikutvecklingen.
* Innovativ kultur: Arbeta tillsammans med några av de främsta experterna inom data, analys och utveckling


 Utöver detta får du även ta del av följande
 **förmåner** 
 :
   

  

 💰Fast lön oberoende av beläggningsgrad
   

  

 🏦Pensionsavsättning i linje med ITP1 samt möjlighet till löneväxling till ditt pensionssparande vid inkomst över 8,07 inkomstbasbelopp
   

  

 🛋️ Möjligheter till flex för en god work-life-balance
   

  

 🏖️ 30 semesterdagar
   

  

 🩺 Sjukvårdsförsäkring via Skandia för både din mentala och fysiska hälsa som täcker dig även utanför tjänstetid
   

  

 🏋️‍♀️ Friskvårdsbidrag på 5000 kr via Benifex (tidigare Benify).
   

  

 💻 Ett brett nätverk av erfarna specialister från olika områden inom tech att samarbeta med
   

  

 🔗 Intern coach för att stödja ditt välbefinnande
   

  

 🪩 After Work och hobbyaktiviteter; så som “bad movie night” och “board game night”
   

  

 🥐 Fredagsfrukost
   

  

**Vilka är vi?**
 Solita är ett värderingsstyrt konsultbolag med över 2000 medarbetare i 9 länder, varav 230 i Sverige. Vår storlek gör oss tillräckligt stora för att vara en stabil och innovativ arbetsgivare, men samtidigt tillräckligt små för att värna om våra medarbetare och kunder. Med bred kompetens inom digital transformation erbjuder vi en dynamisk arbetsmiljö. Hos oss får du friheten att utvecklas, både professionellt och personligt.
   

  

**Intresserad av att höra mer?** 
 Låter det som en spännande utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan och bli en del av vårt team som ligger i framkant inom data. Om du har några frågor, kontakta rekryteringsansvarig, Sara Lindström sara.lindstrom(at)solita.se.
   

  

**Hur ser processen ut?** 
 I rekryteringsprocessen tror vi på en gedigen och effektiv process. Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande. Om vi ser en potentiell matchning, bjuder vi in dig till ett första möte för att lära känna dig och berätta mer om vår kultur och våra värderingar på Solita. I andra intervjun fokuserar vi på din tekniska kompetens och din erfarenhet. Om allt går bra tar vi oss vidare till sista steget där vi presenterar ett erbjudande och välkomnar dig som ny Solitan!
