title: Sales Account Executive (all genders) - Stockholm
description:
**”Accelerating business to improve the lives of people”. This is our purpose statement and encapsulates what we enthusiastically do every day. We integrate our customers’ IT systems to make sure that the right data is at the right place at the right time when they digitalize their processes. Companies need their systems to talk to each other to ensure that cars roll off the factory line, that everyone receives their payments on time, and that you can buy what you need from a supermarket.**
**Our success story began in 1986, when we helped the German automotive industry to digitalize their paper-based supply chains. Today, SEEBURGER is a leading global B2B software provider with more than 1,000 #businessaccelerators in 15 countries worldwide and over 10,000 satisfied customers that rely on our innovative solutions.**
**The Position**
 We are searching for a dynamic and strategic Sales Account Executive to drive growth and close high-value deals. This role is pivotal in expanding our presence across the Nordics and offers significant influence in shaping the regional sales strategy.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Ideally based in Stockholm, Sweden, reporting to the Northern European Head of Sales.
   

  

 This position requires an experienced sales professional who thrives in complex, long-cycle sales processes and excels at negotiating with C-level executives, product owners, and business leaders. You will have the unique opportunity to influence and develop the market while working collaboratively within a growing and entrepreneurial team environment.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Develop and execute a strategic sales plan to acquire new named accounts and expand existing business relationships.
* Engage with C-level executives and key decision-makers to build trust and drive high-value negotiations.
* Navigate long sales cycles (3-12 months) with a solution-oriented sales approach, ensuring a focus on value-driven discussions.
* Work closely with internal stakeholders, including presales, business development, and technical teams, to structure compelling solutions.
* Lead complex sales processes, including contract negotiations and procurement discussions.
* Establish SEEBURGER as a trusted partner by understanding customer pain points and aligning our integration solutions to their strategic needs.
* Communicate the value of SEEBURGER’s B2B/EDI, API integration, MFT, and cloud-based solutions, ensuring clients understand how these technologies address their business challenges.
* Collaborate with global sales and marketing teams to optimize outreach and lead generation.


**Your Profile**
* Several years of experience in B2B enterprise sales, preferably within software, cloud solutions, or business integration services.
* Proven track record in closing large, complex enterprise deals and working with C-level stakeholders.
* Strong negotiation and consultative selling skills, with the ability to drive deals through extended sales cycles.
* Ability to balance a hunter mentality with the patience required for strategic, long-term sales.
* Entrepreneurial mindset with a passion for building and shaping a growing team, market and organisation.
* Excellent communication skills in English and Swedish.
* Familiarity with CRM tools such as Microsoft Dynamics is beneficial.
* Understanding of business integration technologies such as B2B/EDI, API management, cloud integration, and managed file transfer (MFT) is a plus.
* Experience selling to industries such as Automotive, retail, logistics, finance, and manufacturing is a plus.


**Why Join SEEBURGER?**
* Opportunity to shape and influence the Nordic market within a fast-growing, internationally recognized integration leader.
* A high-impact role where you can directly contribute to revenue growth and market expansion.
* Competitive compensation, including a strong commission structure and incentives.
* A collaborative and entrepreneurial team environment, working closely with senior leadership.
* The chance to work with some of the largest international brands and enterprise clients.


 If you are a results-driven enterprise sales professional with a passion for high-stakes negotiations and long-term business growth, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

**Contact Recruiting**
**Nina Muckenfuß**
**recruiting@seeburger.com**
**LinkedIn - XING**
**Benefit from being part of a globally renowned company that is driving digitalisation forward. We continue to grow - and so can you! It is important to us that you can fully utilise your talents and strengths and go your own way, regardless of whether you are aiming for a specialist or management career. With our expertise and growth in a future-oriented industry, we offer a wide range of opportunities and secure jobs. At SEEBURGER, we value the supportive atmosphere and family environment. #StrongerTogether is one of our corporate values and characterises the way we live together.**
**Sounds exciting? Become a #Businessaccelerator today!**

title: Procurement Lead
description:
**Join us to deliver a smoke- free future as Procurement Lead!**
 We’ve chosen to do something incredible. We’re totally transforming our business and building our future on one clear purpose – to deliver a smoke-free future. Swedish Match is an affiliate of PMI and have been a leader in the industry for more than 200 years.
   

  

 In the Nordic region, we are 1,600 employees based in Sweden, Denmark, Finland and Norway working in various functions and teams and together we are collaborating to deliver a smoke-free Nordics.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 You will support the Nordic Procurement by optimizing procurement of products and services by liaising with local departments to understand their current and anticipated demand or needs. You will also be implementing local sourcing strategies, optimizing the local supplier base and managing local supplier contracts.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Work closely with local/cluster collaborators to understand their needs and project strategies. Actively engage in important projects and collaborate with other teams to address customer support issues.
* Collect and study industry, supply market, and internal spend data for assigned subcategories to aid Procurement Manager/Supervisor in defining sourcing scenarios/strategies.
* Gather and combine affiliate spending data and products’ details in assigned categories. Collaborate with local/cluster teams to grasp their business priorities. Find and suggest ways to align the supply chain, and streamline products/services to boost efficiency.
* Research, identify, and assess suppliers. Develop, implement, and analyze medium to complex RFx’s and negotiations at local/cluster Level.
* Manage relationships with local suppliers, vendors, or subcontractors to maintain service standards.
* Understand the main legal templates and their characteristics, ensuring agreements are accurately set up following Law Department’s guidelines and advice. Check, review, and process contracts ensuring that all relevant components are included.
* Maintain and update price lists and agreements in order to guarantee accurate documentation for purchasing decisions.
* Enhance business connections with suppliers through regular evaluations. Coordinate with collaborators to track critical suppliers' performance. Schedule meetings to set and track goals.
* Have a good understanding of the sourcing process and its interactions with other functional processes. Adhere to Global Procurement Policy and Regional Sourcing Practices & Tools ensuring Compliance at affiliate/cluster level.
* Make sure that sourcing plan and RFx initiatives are well tracked and detailed in the regional/global system. Optimize assigned important metric targets.
* Collaborate in an effective and efficient manner with the Shared Service Center (SSC) and/or remote colleagues to ensure activities are carried out in an efficient way.
* Monitor the progress of the tasks assigned to SSC as per agreed annual plans (if applicable).


**Who You Are**
* University degree in Engineering, Business Administration or Economics.
* A Diploma from a recognized Procurement Institute would be an asset.
* +3 years of experience in sourcing, preferably across Logistics and / or marketing and Sales categories with orientation in digital.
* Proficiency in English is required.
* Alternatively, within PMI, Key Account or trade, Sales or Consumer Engagement experience.


 Please note that relocation support is not available for this job.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Our success depends on the dedicated people who come to work every single day with a sense of purpose and an appetite for progress. Join Swedish Match and you too can:
   

  

* Seize the freedom to define your future and ours. We’ll empower you to take risks, experiment and explore.
* Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone’s contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world’s best people and feel like you belong.
* Enjoy flexibility of hybrid way of working - split your time between working from our office or the comfort of your home, where it works best for you in line with business needs.
* Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business – our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.
* Take pride in delivering our promise to society: to deliver a smoke-free future.


 #SWMA
   

  

**8612**

title: Erfaren revisor till Forensic Services
description:
Har du jobbat ett antal år inom finansiell revision och är ute efter nya utmaningar inom utredningsverksamheten på ett av världens ledande revisions- och rådgivningsföretag? Då kan detta vara något för dig!
   

  

**Bli en del av PwC:s utredningsteam**
 Som medarbetare inom PwC:s forensiska team stöttar du företag och organisationer inom den privata, offentliga och finansiella sektorn. Vårt tjänsteutbud innefattar bland annat utredningar, förebyggande arbete mot penningtvätt, visselblåsarfunktioner, bakgrundskontroller, IT-forensik samt många andra tjänster ämnade åt att identifiera oegentligheter och stärka våra kunders organisationer. Dina arbetsdagar varierar med dina projekt, ena veckan arbetar du med att genomföra datainsamling hos kund, för att nästa vecka genomföra en djupgående finansiell granskning på vårt kontor. Du arbetar alltid tillsammans med andra i team för att stötta våra kunder att lösa sina utmaningar och skapa långsiktigt hållbara lösningar. Som företag handlar vårt arbete inte bara om våra kunder och medarbetare – vi vill även bidra till ett mer hållbart och rättvist samhälle för alla. Läs mer om våra tjänsteområden inom Forensic Services.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 PwC:s forensiska team söker nu dig som har arbetslivserfarenhet inom finansiell revision och som vill arbeta med forensiska utredningar och där få möjligheten att tillämpa dina kunskaper inom redovisning och revision inom ramen för forensiska utredningar. Arbetsuppgifterna varierar beroende på typen av utredning och kan skilja sig från projekt till projekt. Vi söker dig som trivs med både praktiskt analysarbete och att leda team och projekt.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker en erfaren revisor med en lämplig akademisk examen och cirka 4-6 års arbetserfarenhet. Vi ser gärna att du är auktoriserad revisor. Du behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifterna på Forensic Services förutsätter en tydlig analytisk förmåga och utpräglat affärssinne kombinerat med stort engagemang och stark drivkraft. Arbetet är mycket varierande vilket även ställer krav på flexibilitet och nyfikenhet. Du är även ansvarstagande och lägger stor vikt vid att leverera goda resultat. För att trivas hos oss arbetar du som effektiv lagspelare och delar gärna med dig av din erfarenhet och kunskap.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Välkommen med din ansökan till oss senast den 18 maj 2025.
   

  

 Tillträde: Omgående enligt överenskommelse
   

  

**Rekryteringsprocessen**
 Vi kommer att gå igenom ansökningarna löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas tidigare än sista ansökningsdagen.
   

  

**Vi ber dig bifoga följande handlingar med din ansökan:**
* CV
* Personligt brev


 Vi tror på att ha en rekryteringsprocess som gäller för alla. För att bidra till en opartisk och rättvis urvalsprocess inkluderar vi arbetspsykologiska tester.
   

  

 Vi värdesätter det personliga mötet för att se vilket värde just du kan tillföra PwC men också vad vi kan erbjuda dig. Intervjuprocessen består vanligtvis av flera steg och olika typer av intervjuer. När du träffar HR, har du en kompetensbaserad intervju där vi tittar på personlighetstestet som du genomfört innan intervjun. Vid intervjun med verksamheten får du möjlighet att träffa det aktuella teamet för att gå igenom rollen. Vi kallar till intervju löpande.

title: Senior Salesforce Consultant
description:
**What We Are Looking For** 




  




* You should be the person that can show potential customers how a Salesforce solution can unleash the customers full potential in CPQ, Sales or Service Cloud.
* A senior Salesforce consultant with 5+ years experience
* You will have a strong track record of delivering Salesforce solutions at your customers and therefore have a great reputation with them. This reputation will have allowed you to expand your offering with them.
* An excellent business developer, someone who understands how to build relationships with clients and create new opportunities in Sweden.
* Someone who can attract top Salesforce talent to Monfido.
* A proactive business builder, who has the drive and personality to help Monfido grow.
* Fluency in Swedish



  





  





**What We Will Offer** 




  




* The opportunity to join a new Salesforce consulting company, where you will have the mandate to lead Monfido on their growth journey.
* To leverage your experience into an environment where you have the possibility to shape your own role and target model.
* You will have a clear growth target in relation to new business creation and talent attraction.
* A challenging and international business environment and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field.
* To be part of an alliance of ten consulting companies, that employ approximately 260 consultants. Within Newground Alliance, you will have the opportunity to collaborate and work with other the companies and their colleagues



  





  





**Who Is Monfido** 




  





 We are a new player on the market aiming to change the way Salesforce projects are done. With our background in the industry, we have seen many examples of what works, and more importantly, what doesn’t work. We love Salesforce, but we also know it can be confusing – and that once they’ve bought it, many companies simply don’t know how to realise value from it.
 



  





 We aim to change that.
 



  





 By bringing people and processes together, we work to ensure consistency, compliance, and scalability for our customers. We know businesses can get more from Salesforce. We’re the people who can make it happen.
 



  





 Monfido is part of Newground Alliance, a group of independent, multi-sector specialist consultancies. We put tasks and people before process and structure, and simplicity before ego.
 



 That’s consulting done right
 



  





 We are obsessed with creating value for our clients – we will radically simplify everything that gets in the way of achieving this goal. Because it’s only by asking the right questions that we can find better answers.

title: Operational Buyer
description:
We’re looking for a
   

  

**Operational Buyer**
*Every day, we get opportunities to make a positive impact – on our colleagues, partners, customers and society. Together, we’re pioneering the solutions of the future and unlocking the full potential of precious resources. Trusted to act on initiative, we challenge conventional thinking to develop world-leading technologies that inspire progress in vital areas, including energy, food, water and shipping.*
*As we push forward, the innovative, open spirit that fuels our 140-year-old start-up culture and rapid growth also drives our personal growth. So, as we shape a more resourceful, less wasteful world, we build our careers too.*
**About The Job**
 We are looking for a Operational Buyer to join our Purchasing Department at Engineering & Supply. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring the project-specific supply of components to our customer projects.
   

  

**Your Daily Tasks Will Include**
* Reviewing technical documentation for project needs
* Ordering components and managing suppliers
* Ensuring on-time delivery and quality assurance
* Working closely with internal teams to meet project deadlines
* Identifying ways to reduce costs and improve delivery times


 You will work throughout the entire project process, from quotation to delivery, and handle purchasing for customer-specific and customized projects (ETO – Engineering to Order & CTO – Configuration to Order). You will also manage existing orders and operational purchasing tasks.
   

  

 This is a great opportunity for someone who enjoys a broad purchasing role, working with different components, from raw materials to process components and flow control, within industries such as food, beverage, and life sciences.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 To succeed in this role, you:
   

  

* Enjoy working in a fast-paced environment with multiple tasks at once
* Are a team player who collaborates well with colleagues to achieve common goals
* Have an eye for improvements and enjoy working in a dynamic business
* Are independent, analytical, and structured in your approach
* Like operational purchasing tasks and feel comfortable in a hands-on purchasing role


**What You Know**
 We are looking for someone with:
   

  

* A university degree in engineering, purchasing, or logistics
* 2-3 years of experience in operational purchasing, preferably in the engineering industry
* Knowledge of components from the process industry
* Experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP system
* Good understanding of Lean Six Sigma project methodology
* Strong skills in Microsoft Office
* Fluent English (both spoken and written)


 If you enjoy working with project-specific purchases, handling supplier relationships, and contributing to successful deliveries, this is the perfect role for you!
   

  

**What’s in it for you?**
 We offer a challenging position in an open and friendly environment where we help each other to develop and create value. Your work will have a true impact on Alfa Laval’s future success.
   

  

**For more information, please contact**
 Anna-Karin Stenstrand, Procurement Manager - Supply, annakarin.stenstrand@alfalaval.com
   

  

 Richa Sethi, Talent Acquisition Partner, richa.sethi@alfalaval.com
   

  

**For union information, please contact**
 Linda Oxel, Akademikerna, linda.oxel@alfalaval.com
   

  

 Anders Jansson, Unionen, anders.jansson@alfalaval.com
   

  

 Please submit in your application no later than
 **22nd April 2025** 
**,** 
 through our career page.
   

  

**Welcome with your application!**
*GDPR Compliant*
*Applications sent directly via email will be disregarded without notice due to.*

title: Senior Sales Executive, Baltics
description:
Brite Payments is a leading European Account to Account (A2A) payment provider (powered by Open Banking) of Instant Payments and Payouts. We provide a faster, smarter and more secure payment experience for merchants and their users.
   

  

***Want to join us on our journey? The future is brite!***
 As a Senior Sales Executive, Baltics you will play a leading role in the region's commercial success by finding, selling and closing new business opportunities. You will be part of an experienced, driven and inclusive team that is changing the face of payments by unlocking Instant, Account-to-Account payments and payouts.
   

  

**Are you a Brite mind?**
 We are looking for individuals with a proven sales track record of winning new business and achieving ambitious targets with enterprise merchants in The Baltics. This role requires a critical understanding of merchant needs and payment challenges, who can translate these into a clear and compelling sales motion.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will have previous experience in payments and with an existing professional network within one or more of our target verticals, these include but are not limited to: E-commerce / Financial Services & Insurance / Digital Platforms / Travel and mobility.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will bring:
   

  

* 5 + years of sales experience within a payments, fintech, banking leader
* Proficient in sales methodologies, multi-threaded sales and value selling
* Experienced selling to Enterprise merchants
* Ability to outbound themselves in a efficient and scalable way
* Diligent with forecasting, data and pricing
* Salesforce & commercial tooling experience
* Great presentation and communication skills
* Fluent in English


**Your Responsibilities**
* Build a strong pipeline within your territory plan, identifying and engaging with all relevant merchants and stakeholders.
* Leverage your professional and personal network to get a foot in the door and accelerate sales cycles.
* Happy with building prospecting lists and working closely with our Head of North East & Central Europe and CCO to define and execute a playbook that delivers new business within agreed timescales for your territory plan.
* Pitch Brite’s product portfolio (Instant Payments, Instant Payouts, Data Solutions), tailoring it to your prospects needs and being able to explain how our solutions are differentiated from our competitors.
* Use our CRM tool (Salesforce) to accurately input data, track and manage your opportunities daily.
* Deliver exceptional buying experiences to your prospects, representing the challenger spirit of Brite through a high integrity & open availability approach.
* You are a communicator who can explain complex topics in an easily understandable way.


**A successful candidate will;**
* Demonstrate how to qualify the right prospects and focus their time for maximum impact i.e. discovery calls that fit our ICP leading to value selling.
* Explain how they can influence key stakeholders (from the economic buyer to champions).
* Show how they have executed an effective sales strategy in the past, supported by detailed examples.
* Speak about how they have successfully communicated technical payment solutions to prospects in the past leading to a won opportunity.
* Exhibit how they have worked a sales cycle from first contact to live.


**What We Offer**
* Become part of Europe’s hottest Fintech, founded and led by some of the best in the industry that raised the largest Series A ($60 Mn) in Europe last year.
* This is your chance to leave your mark, enjoying the journey whilst working alongside experienced industry leaders who have done it before and want to do it again.
* An optimistic, empathetic, and inclusive culture where we want you to be yourself. We believe in continuous learning and knowledge exchange.
* Gain exposure to a wide range of verticals and use cases for Instant A2A Payments, meaning you will work with the most exciting, fast growth businesses in the Baltics.
* An annual wellbeing and professional development allowance. We promote our people to invest in themselves and unlock their full potential through courses, personal coaching.

title: Tekniker inom 2nd line support
description:
Centric söker nu supporttekniker med minst två års erfarenhet av IT-support på 2nd line nivå till uppdrag hos en kund som behöver stärka sin 2nd line support.
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
   

  

 Uppdraget är på heltid och kommer att pågå tills vidare.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 Som tekniker inom 2nd line support kommer du arbeta med att ta emot och lösa incidenter samt problem som eskalerats från 1st line. Du kommer att arbeta nära verksamheten och ärendena löser du via telefon, remote och onsite. Att lösa de mer komplexa problemen med hjälp av grundlig felsökning är en stor del av arbetet. Du kommer att arbeta med dagligt installations- och serviceunderhåll, säkerhetslösningar samt supportarbete på utrustning samt i system och applikationer såsom Microsoft 365, Azure och Intune.
   

  

**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har arbetet i minst två år med liknande arbetsuppgifter och inom IT i fem år. Som person har du ett strukturerat tankesätt med uppmärksamhet på detaljer. Du är tekniskt kunnig, en riktig lagspelare samt talar och skriver svenska och engelska flytande.
   

  

*Krav*
* Erfarenhet av djupare felsökning
* Goda kunskaper inom Microsoft 365 och Azure
* Erfarenhet av Windows Server 2016 och uppåt – uppsättning och underhåll
* God nätverksförståelse


*Meriterande*
* Erfarenhet kring olika backuplösningar
* Erfarenhet av virtualisering
* B-körkort


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi sätter stort värde på att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande och roliga aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under trevliga och avslappnande former.
   

  

*Mer om oss*
 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, och med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Supporttekniker till IT-servicedesk | Stockholm
description:
**IT-nörd + Grant Thornton = bra match.** 
 Som supporttekniker på Grant Thornton får du arbeta nära många kompetenta kollegor, allt ifrån tjänsteägare till specialister - och det är när IT-delarna strular som du blir den viktigaste personen på hela bolaget.
   

  

 Hälsa och välmående värderas högt hos oss och därför är en flexibel vardag och bra förmåner en självklarhet.
   

  

**Om** 
**rollen**
 Rollen som supporttekniker innebär att dagligen stötta våra drygt 1400 kollegor runtom i landet med tekniska frågor och diverse problem. Du kommer att börja arbeta relativt omgående då detta är en ersättningsrekrytering. Vi förväntar oss hög kvalitét och tydligt fokus på slutanvändaren och därför är det viktigt att du kommer in med erfarenhet från tidigare arbetsplats. Du kommer att tillhöra ett team på 13 personer som ansvarar för IT-drift och leverans av tjänster till vår verksamhet på 22 kontor i Sverige. Teamet tillhör vår IT-avdelning på ca 45 personer med uppdrag att leverera moderna, kvalitativa men framförallt säkra tjänster till våra samtliga affärsområden. Du erbjuds utvecklingsmöjligheter genom ansvar för uppgifter utanför din ordinarie roll samt genom att bidra till utvecklingen av vår servicedesk.
   

  

**Grant Thornton** 
 är en av Sveriges främsta revisions- och konsultbyråer med fokus på entreprenörer och tillväxtbolag där vi stöttar 15 000 kunder i Sverige med hållbar tillväxt genom tjänster inom revision, redovisning, lön, skatt och rådgivning. Vi är en hel del anställda och som du förstår behöver vi riktigt duktiga personer i servicedesken!
   

  

 Vi sitter i fina nyrenoverade lokaler mitt i city på Kungsgatan 57 och erbjuder delvis möjlighet till distansarbete hemifrån. På kontoret har du även möjlighet att fylla på blodsockret mellan kl. 09:00 - 15:00 då vi har en snacksbar på nedersta planet.
   

  

 Du kan läsa mer om våra förmåner här.
   

  

 Vi erhåller en inkluderande och stödjande arbetsmiljö där vi värdesätter mångfald och jämställdhet. Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till vårt team!
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Som du förstår är vi i behov av någon som kan komma in i rollen både med förmågan att uppmärksamma problem men också genom att lösa dem. Både kvalitét och service är av stort fokus för oss. Som person har du förmågan att analysera och prioritera dina arbetsuppgifter löpande och självledarskap är något vi jobbar med som övergripande mål.
   

  

 Utöver att du är en driven och engagerad person som tar eget ansvar och vill göra skillnad för våra medarbetare ser vi även att du besitter lite tekniska erfarenheter och dom hittar du nedan:
   

  

* Arbetat minst 2 år i en servicedesk
* Teknisk support i Windowsmiljö
* Support till slutanvändare via telefon och ärendehanteringssystem
* Onsite support
* Administration i Active Directory, Microsoft 365, Exchange Online och Intune
* Felsökning av Windows 10/11, Microsoft 365-appar, iOS och OneDrive för Företag
* Enklare nätverks- och WiFi-problem
* Hantering av hårdvara (laptops och skrivare)
* Ärendehanteringssystem och fjärrstyrningsverktyg
* Installation av applikationer
* Dokumentation och skapande av kunskapsbaser


 Detta är meriterande:
   

  

 Om du har arbetat med SharePoint Online och hanterat Azure AD och Entra ID. Du har arbetat med olika ekonomi-, redovisnings- och bokföringssystem och har erfarenhet av att ge support för telefonitjänster och växelsystem. Du är också bekant med att hantera skrivare, särskilt i Canon Uniflow, och har avancerad kunskap i felsökning av iOS-enheter. Vi värdesätter din erfarenhet av att hantera onboarding- och offboardingprocesser samt större incidenter. God kommunikationsförmåga och kunskap i generativ AI, såsom GPT, är också viktigt.
   

  

**Om mig som ledare**
 Du kommer att rapportera till mig, Tommy Andersson, Service Area Manager Servicedesk. Som ledare gör jag mitt yttersta för att skapa förutsättningar för mina kollegor i att utvecklas och lyckas. Jag ansvarar för våra övergripande mål och stöttar dig med råd och vägledning. Jag värnar vår arbetsmiljö högt och jobbar ständigt för att mina kollegor ska känna glädje i sin arbetsvardag. Kontakta mig gärna om du har frågor om tjänsten på tommy.andersson@se.gt.com.
   

  

**Mer om tjänsten och rekryteringsprocessen**
 Tjänsten är på heltid med start enligt överenskommelse. Ansök genom att skicka in CV och svara på urvalsfrågorna på nästa sida. Notera att vi inte arbetar med personligt brev. Sista ansökningsdag är söndagen den 18 maj.
   

  

 Rekryteringsprocessen inkluderar telefonintervju, arbetspsykologiska tester och referenser samt intervju med rekryterande chef.
   

  

 Som ett kvalitativt led i vår rekryteringsprocess genomför vi en bakgrundskontroll, med kandidatens godkännande, på våra slutkandidater. Det kan t.ex. innebära kontroll av personuppgifter, ekonomiska förhållanden och juridiska frågor.
   

  

 Vi arbetar med löpande urval så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vi värnar dina personuppgifter och tar därför inte emot ansökningar via e-post.
   

  

 Vi som arbetar med den här rekryteringsprocessen är Vendela Bennström och Tommy Andersson.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer om Grant Thornton som arbetsgivare?**
* Om Grant Thornton
* Vår kultur och våra värderingar


**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Security Engineer
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the team** 




 As part of fulfilling the objective of becoming the leading global online banking payments provider, we are strengthening our capability in the information and cyber security area. Currently, we are restructuring our internal setup within the security area allowing us to scale and grow our teams.
 







 To get us going we are now looking for additional Security Engineers to join the Security and Compliance team focusing on our product security in Europe.
 







**About the role** 




 As a Security Engineer at Trustly, you will be part of a team of security professionals ensuring security lies in the core of everything we build and operate. We combine our expertise in providing security services to the organization with automating security controls wherever and whenever possible.
 







 As our team is undergoing an expansive phase, you will have the opportunity to shape our direction and methodologies. Your contributions will be important in refining our interactions with merchants, allowing you to leave a large impact on our operational security framework.
 




  




**What you’ll do** 
* Ensure our vulnerability management program maintains coverage of all applicable assets, by building automation that makes sure our tools are up to date and supports our teams to keep our software secure
* Perform security assessments and provide security guidance of the product we build through design reviews, code reviews as well as performing dynamic testing, working closely with the development teams
* Research and implement security controls on top of the CI/CD pipeline
* Design and execute internal penetration testing activities
* Compromise our hosts and data with exploitation of vulnerabilities to assess actual risks involved and understand what controls that failed to protect
* Proactively gather threat intelligence and build tools that enable us to identify and act on external threats efficiently and intelligently



  




**Who you are** 
* You have spent a few years in the area of cyber security doing hands-on technical security work
* Detailed technical knowledge of techniques, standards and state-of-the art capabilities for authentication and authorisation, applied cryptography, security vulnerabilities and remediation
* DNS, TLS, X.509, CVEs and SOAR/SIEM systems are no strangers to you
* Experience from hands-on technical security assessments such as penetration tests, web application tests, code reviews etc
* Passionate about working with application developers in "shifting left", introducing security controls early on in the development process
* Any security certification (e.g. OSCP, OSWE or similar)
* Bachelor/Masters/PhD degree in Computer Science or Cybersecurity is considered a plus






  




  


**Our Fantastic Benefits**




 🌴
 **20 to 30 days of holiday** 
 (depending on location) to support a healthy work-life balance
 



 🥳
 **Monthly team outing allowance** 
 to enjoy social events with your colleagues
 



 👶
 **Parental leave top-up** 
 additional support for new parents
 



 🥐
 **Daily breakfast and on-site perks** 
 to make your workday smoother
 



 💚
 **Well being support** 
 our health allowance covers gym memberships, massages, and much more to help you feel your best
 



**PLUS** 
 additional benefits designed to enhance your work-life experience!
 







**Shape Your Role and Make an Impact**




 Join a dynamic environment where you can take ownership, drive change, and continuously embrace new challenges. We’re looking for dedicated and highly motivated individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy collaborating across different areas of the organisation.
 



 If your skills and experience align with this role, we’d love to hear from you!
 **Apply now and submit your CV in English.**

title: Global Application Manager
description:
*Every day, we get opportunities to make a positive impact – on our colleagues, partners, customers and society. Together, we’re pioneering the solutions of the future and unlocking the full potential of precious resources. Trusted to act on initiative, we challenge conventional thinking to develop world-leading technologies that inspire progress in vital areas, including energy, food, water and shipping.*
*As we push forward, the innovative, open spirit that fuels our 140-year-old start-up culture and rapid growth also drives our personal growth. So, as we shape a more resourceful, less wasteful world, we build our careers too.*
 Alfa Laval builds on a century-long commitment to the Maritime industry. We help ship owners and operators secure confident compliance with marine legislation, both through dedicated technologies and by supporting the move to new fuels. Keeping reliability and ease of use in focus, we increase productivity, protect the engine, boost energy efficiency and minimize waste, contributing to higher earnings and lower lifecycle cost.
   

  

**About The Job**
 The marine market is an international business and, as
 **Global Application Manager** 
 , you will work both internally and externally all over the world.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Investigate, coordinate and manage claim activities.
* Provide daily support to customers and sales companies.
* Conduct troubleshooting activities both on-site and in the field.
* Develop and maintain training materials for internal and external use.
* Collect and analyze market insights to feed into business strategies.
* Perform business analysis to support decision-making processes.
* Ensure the Share site is consistently updated with relevant information.
* Assist in the development of applications.
* Monitor trends and developments in the marine industry, including fuel types, legislation, technology, and competitor intelligence.
* Participate in product-, and process development projects, including prototype and concept development.
* Share application knowledge through internal and external training sessions.
* Perform equipment tests both in-house and in the field.


 You will work in close cooperation with the Sales Companies and Regional Business Managers as well as with the R&D team. The position requires approximately 30 days travel/year.
   

  

 This position is based in Tumba, Sweden until Spring 2025, from then onwards in Flemingsberg, Sweden.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for a highly motivated person with a passion for problem solving, customer support, application development, business development and continuous improvements. You can build strong networks and work across borders, with people on different levels and cultures. You are target-oriented and have a creative and open-minded approach. Additionally, you take ownership and drive initiatives in a self-sufficient way. We believe you have a curios mindset for new applications and to push the development of our products further.
   

  

**What You Know**
 You hold an engineering degree with approximately 2-3 years of working experience after graduation. You are a good team player, and you have excellent communication skills, both verbally and in writing. You enjoy working in a matrix organization with many interfaces. Fluency in English is required.
   

  

**What’s in it for you?**
 We offer a challenging position in an open and innovative environment. Your work will have a true impact for a sustainable future and Alfa Laval’s future success. You will be working with highly motivated colleagues where knowledge sharing, and collaboration is key.
   

  

**About Alfa Laval In Tumba**
 Alfa Laval, currently located in the southern part of Stockholm in Tumba, is set to relocate during Spring 2025 to Flemingsberg, Sweden's largest urban business development area. Alfa Laval is shaping a vibrant and dynamic workplace that aims to inspire both existing and future employees. Additionally, this new site will provide an exceptional experience for employees, customers, and visitors.
   

  

  

  

 The focus at the new location will be on people, with modern offices and a digital workplace designed to enhance productivity and well-being. Furthermore, there will be a state-of-the-art high-tech lab dedicated to developing and testing products related to high-speed separation and emerging technologies.
   

  

**For more information, please contact**
 Ayla Körlof, Global Business Manager, Ayla.Korlof@alfalaval.com
   

  

 Regina García Moguel, Talent Acquisition Partner, regina.garciamoguel@alfalaval.com
   

  

**Union information**
 Francisco Garcia, Akademikerföreningen,  +46 733 995 684
   

  

 Anders Jansson, Unionen, +46 730 780 482
   

  

 We review applications on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to submit yours by
 **April 18t** 
**h, 2025** 
 , at the latest. Please be aware that the application process may close earlier if we identify suitable candidates, so don’t delay in applying.
   

  

 Please note that, in compliance with GDPR, we cannot accept applications submitted via email.
   

  

*We care about diversity, inclusion, and equity in our recruitment processes. We also believe behavioural traits can provide important insights into a candidate's fit to a role. To help us achieve this we apply Pymetrics assessments, and upon application you will be invited to play the assessment games.*

title: IT Business Partner - Finance (Stockholm, SE)
description:
At EasyPark, we love cities. We love them for work, for play and everything in between. That’s why our mission is to make life in cities that much easier – by taking care of the parking. With the use of technology, we break barriers, helping improve the urban experience. Our aim is to create a scenario where parking supply and driver demand are balanced not due to additional parking spots and fewer cars, but thanks to predictive technology that connects our users to available spots.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 We are currently looking for an IT Business Partner (Finance) to join our team based in Stockholm to become a true bridge between the business and IT, driving innovation, improving efficiency, and ultimately contributing to the overall success of the organization.
   

  

**You Will Contribute & Make An Impact Through**
* Align technology solutions with strategic business objectives
* Foster strong partnerships with business stakeholders
* Drive innovation and process improvement
* Optimize the use of technology to achieve business goals
* Empower the organization to achieve its full potential through effective technology utilization


 As an IT Business Partner at Easypark you will be responible for:
   

  

* Strategic Alignment and Partnership
+ Business Liaison: Serve as the primary point of contact between IT and assigned business units, fostering strong relationships and understanding their unique needs.
+ Strategic Planning: Collaborate with business leaders and IT teams to develop and execute IT strategies that align with overall business objectives.
+ Requirements Gathering: Elicit, analyze, and validate business requirements, translating them into clear and actionable technical specifications.
+ Business Case Development: Lead the development of robust business cases to justify IT investments and prioritize initiatives.

* Project Delivery and Execution
+ Project Management: Oversee IT projects from initiation to closure, control timely delivery, budget adherence, and stakeholder satisfaction.
+ Solution Design: Work with technical teams to design, implement, and maintain technology solutions that address business needs and drive value.
+ Change Management: Effectively manage change initiatives, minimizing disruption and maximizing adoption of new technologies.

* Continuous Improvement and Collaboration
+ Fostering a Culture of Collaboration: Promote a collaborative work environment, encouraging open communication and knowledge sharing between IT and business teams.
+ Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvement and drive initiatives to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
+ Adaptability: Stay abreast of emerging technologies and industry trends to anticipate future business needs and proactively propose innovative solutions.

* Effective Communication
+ Stakeholder Communication: Communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels, tailoring messages to their specific needs and understanding.
+ Progress Reporting: Provide regular updates on project status, key performance indicators, and potential risks.


**About You**
* Strong understanding of business operations and IT capabilities
* Previous Finance and ERP knowledge / experience (Netsuite)
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Proven ability to build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Ability to audit multiple projects and priorities simultaneously (not a project manager)
* Experience in project management methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall)
* Knowledge of ITIL or other IT service management frameworks
* Ability to adapt to changing priorities and business needs
* Manufacturing and supply chain knowledge would be beneficial


 Apply for this job

title: Data Engineer
description:
**About The Team**
 Bravida’s
 **Operations Excellence Group** 
 has established
 **the Data & Analytics (D&A) team,** 
 a dedicated group focused on unlocking the full potential of our data.
   

  

 Our mission is to transform raw data into actionable insights that drive smarter decision-making, streamline operations, and enhance customer experiences. We help Bravida optimize performance, improve efficiency, and fuel long-term success.
   

  

 We are building a robust data ecosystem using a modern tech stack, including
 **Python, Dagster, DBT, Snowflake, Synq and Tableau** 
 . Our goal is to simplify and standardize data processes for internal stakeholders, enabling a seamless and efficient way of working with data.
   

  

 Challenging the status quo is in our DNA, and we continuously strive to improve how we work with data.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a Data Engineer, you will play a crucial role in shaping Bravida’s analytical data layers, serving stakeholders across the organization. Our data plaform is a key asset, supporting a variety of use cases—including
 **business intelligence, decision analytics, data-driven services for facility management and of couse part of our AI workflows** 
 .
   

  

**Your responsibilities will include:**
* Developing data integrations from Bravida source systems to Snowflake
* Developing & maintaining data models that support critical business processes, ensuring data governance and reliability
* Transforming data using SQL (with DBT) and Python to create efficient, scalable data pipelines
* Collaborating on analytical projects, helping stakeholders validate hypotheses and solve complex challenges
* Exploring new technologies & approaches, staying up to date with the latest advancements in data engineering
* Promoting good practices internally & externally, sharing insights and knowledge with the team


**You are** 
**someone with:**
* Experience in a Programming, Data Engineering, or Data Infrastructure roles
* Proficiency in programming languages (Python, Go)
* Strong SQL skills, including analytical functions and data transformation techniques
* Expertise in data modelling, enabling end-user self-service capabilities
* Familiarity with cloud-based and SaaS platforms, such as Snowflake, DBT and Data Observability
* Familiarity with orchestration tools like Dagster / Airflow
* Experience with cloud-platforms such as Azure/AWS/GCP (we use Azure)
* Fluency in English is essential, Swedish and other Scandinavian languages are a plus


**What We Offer**
 Joining Bravida means being part of an exciting journey to revolutionize the construction industry with innovative data solutions. You’ll work with fantastic colleagues on meaningful projects while enjoying:
   

  

 Competitive salary & benefits package (including insurance and pension plans).
   

  

 Career growth opportunities with a transforming industry.
   

  

 A modern office located near Telefonplan, Stockholm.
   

  

 A hybrid work model, allowing flexibility between office and remote work
   

  

 A supportive and collaborative team environment.
   

  

**Bravida as an Employer**
 At Bravida, we are proud to deliver the feeling when everything just works. Our employees have built trust with our customers since 1922 through their expertise and commitment. You, as an employee, are the heart of our organization, and together we ensure the delivery of technical solutions with the highest quality. We strive to create a workplace where everyone feels safe and appreciated, and we constantly work to make the work environment as secure and good as possible. Your safety always comes first.
   

  

 With us, you have the opportunity to develop in your profession. We help you grow in your role and become even better at what you do. Here, we work together and support each other, because we know that great results are best achieved together. As part of our team, you will also have access to great benefits such as health checks and wellness allowances. Read more about what it’s like to work at Bravida here.
   

  

**How do I apply for the job?**
 Applications are processed on an ongoing basis. You can submit your CV and personal letter by clicking the "Apply" button below.
   

  

*We kindly request that recruitment agencies refrain from contacting us during this recruitment process.*

title: Klientspecialist – Applikationspaketering & Windows
description:
Vill du vara en del av ett team som utvecklar och förvaltar serverplattformar, både nya och befintliga? Har du ett genuint teknikintresse inom Windows-området? Om ja, tveka inte att ta nästa steg i din karriär! Vi söker nu en Klientspecialist till vår kunds DevOps-team.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Vi söker efter en Klientspecialist med erfarenhet av applikationspaketering, SCCM och Horizon. I denna roll ansvarar du, tillsammans med dina kollegor, för utveckling och förvaltning inom vår kunds Windows-team.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**
* Applikationspaketering (MSI, App Volume, SCCM)
* Arbeta med MECM/SCCM
* Underhåll och utveckling av Horizon VDI-miljö
* Förvaltning av Windows-miljöer och VDI-plattformar


**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som har god social kompetens och förmågan att arbeta under varierande grad av belastning. Du tar ansvar för att ständigt förbättra arbetssätt, processer och rutiner. Dokumentation är en viktig del av arbetet, vilket gör att du behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Eftersom vi arbetar med system som har höga säkerhetskrav är IT-säkerhet en naturlig del av din vardag.
   

  

**För att trivas i rollen ser vi gärna att du har:**
* Några års erfarenhet inom Windows Server och klient
* Ett genuint tekniskt intresse och viljan att arbeta med den senaste tekniken
* Goda kunskaper i vanligt förekommande scriptspråk, t.ex. PowerShell
* Erfarenhet av applikationspaketering, SCCM och Horizon (genom App Volume
* Erfarenhet av MSI
* Microsoft standardprodukter (Active Directory, DNS, WDS m.m.)
* Erfarenhet av Horizon VDI


 Du kommer att bli en del av ett innovativt IT-team som ansvarar för utveckling, installation, underhåll och förvaltning av företagets IT-miljöer. Vi erbjuder en tekniskt utmanande arbetsmiljö där systematisk drift, förvaltning och teknikbevakning står i fokus.
   

  

**Start** 
 : Omgående start med hänsyn till uppsägningstid. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Ansökan:** 
 Intervjuer sker löpande och tillsättning sker vid rätt match
   

  

**Vad vi står för:**
 Vi på Camai erbjuder ett av marknadens branschledande anställningsvillkor med stor frihet som ledord. Vi drivs av att hitta det bästa uppdraget för våra medarbetare. Det roligaste som finns är att hitta en perfekt matchning mellan konsult och kund. Vi vet att alla har ett drömarbete, och vi är ett tight entreprenörsdrivet team som arbetar för att se till att du tycker att det är roligt att gå till jobbet, varje dag. Vi tror att kompetenta människor dras till varandra och vill jobba med likasinnade i spännande kunduppdrag.
   

  

 Vi har en av marknadens mest förmånliga ersättningsmodell anpassad för en modern konsultorganisation med mycket frihet. Vi har helt enkelt kul tillsammans!
   

  

**Varför ska du välja oss?**
 Med många års erfarenhet i konsultbranschen har vi valt våra tre värdeord med omsorg; kommunikation, ambition och balans. För att lyckas tror vi att våra medarbetare får vara med och forma sitt arbete efter prioriteringar och intresse i livet. Med din ambition och rätt verktyg från oss ser vi till att du utvecklas och samtidigt belönas på vägen.
   

  

*Vill du vara en del av vår fortsatta tillväxt?*

title: Program Manager
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Computer and Network Security
description:
Meet
 
 Yubico
 
 : the inventor of the
 
 YubiKey
 
 ––the world's first and leading security key. Our company’s mission is to make secure login easy and available for everyone. Yubico was founded in 2007 by Stina and Jakob Ehrensvard, and recently went public on Nasdaq Stockholm Main Market: YUBICO. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies, hundreds of government agencies and millions of individuals in over 160 countries that rely on Yubico technology to secure access to computers, online services and mobile apps. We  are a global company with a strong company culture and employees located in over 14 countries. Yubico’s  headquarters are based in  Stockholm, Sweden and Santa Clara, CA.  Aligned with our mission to make the internet more secure for everyone, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations helping at-risk individuals through our philanthropic initiative,
 
 Secure it Forward
 
 .
 








**At Yubico, we offer:**








**Yubico Values:
 
 We work to ensure that our employees have an open space to have their voices amplified to create a workplace where everyone feels like they belong. Aligned with this, our employees have created some pretty cool Employee Resource Groups: YubiPride, YubiBIPOC, YubiSustainability and YubiWomen. Additionally, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations in need all over the world (you can read more about our work here).
 





**Social Connection:**

 Relationships and connectedness matter, and we love spending time with our team! Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether it's through Yubico celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. We host an all-team event in a new location every year where we plan for upcoming quarters, set goals, and most importantly, host fun events to encourage team building outside of the workplace. Check out our
 

 Life at Yubico Page
 

 on LinkedIn and our awards
 

 here
 
**.**




  






 The Role: 
 









 You will organize projects, programs, and activities in accordance with the Yubico mission and goals across organizations. The ideal candidate will be an excellent leader and will have experience in working across different disciplines and with different stakeholders to gain alignment, develop strategies, and tactics to reduce risk and maximize outcomes, ultimately ensuring results are achieved in a planned and timely manner.
 





  




**Tasks & Responsibilities:** 
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams on programs to develop the scope, deliverables, required resources, work plan, budget, and timing for new initiatives, leveraging broad knowledge of program and project management methodologies


* Motivate cross-functional teams on programs, set clear expectations and goals, and provide guidance throughout a program's lifecycle


* Coordinate the projects, interdependencies, and teams across various programs and projects for optimal return on investment


* Monitor and track program deliverables and milestones using program management tools and techniques and ensure project and program objectives are being met


* Identify risks and opportunities across multiple projects to maximize program outcomes, implementing mitigation strategies in risk scenarios to ensure success


* Analyze, evaluate, and overcome program risks, and produce program reports for managers and key stakeholders


* Collaborate across geographically dispersed functions



  




**Basic Qualifications:** 
* One or more of the following:


* Three (3) years’ of experience in program or project management


* Five (5) years’ experience in technology


* Four (4) years’ experience in security


* Technical knowledge of business systems (software and system integrations) and process improvement


* Proven experience as a Program Manager in an IT organization


* Exceptional skills in leadership, time management, facilitation, and organization


* Ability to lead and motivate cross-functional teams, set clear expectations and goals, and provide guidance throughout a project's lifecycle


* Broad knowledge of project or program management methodologies


* Knowledge and proficiency in project management software and tools


* Experience in managing stakeholders


* PMP, CSM, or other relevant certifications are desirable


* Ability to collaborate across geographically dispersed functions






  




  














  





 We are an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity and uphold an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. We'd love to learn about what you can add to our diverse team.
 







 Yubico does not accept agency resumes or referrals so please do not send them to our careers staff or employees. Yubico is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes or referrals.
 







 Personal data submitted through this form is used for managing Yubico’s recruitment activities, which include facilitating any application you make, setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing results and selecting candidates, and as otherwise needed in our recruitment and onboarding processes. The use of your personal data may also be necessary prior to entering into a contract with you (that is prior to offering you a job with Yubico). Your personal data will only be used for the purposes for which it was collected and in accordance with the Yubico Privacy Notice. We only keep your personal data for as long as necessary and in compliance with Yubico’s record retention policies. If you have asked us to, we will keep you informed of other opportunities at Yubico. We do this in various ways, including email and by phone. If at any time you do not want us to contact you or use your information as described herein please contact us at jobs@yubico.com to let us know and we will delete all such information. Providing your personal data is voluntary, but necessary to join our talent community, and if you do not agree to provide your data, we will not be able to consider you as part of our talent community.
 







 As part of providing the requested service, we will transfer your data to be processed by Lever, Inc., a service provider contracted by Yubico AB and/or its subsidiaries that meets legally mandated privacy requirements. The Yubico Privacy Notice offers more information about Yubico privacy practices, including the lawful basis for processing of personal data, how to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority, and how to contact Yubico to exercise your data subject rights. In this notice, when we refer to "Yubico", "us", "we" or "our", we mean the Yubico group company or companies that you apply to, or correspond with, and which are responsible for any personal data collected about you.**

title: Account Manager
description:
**Är du – eller vill du växa och bli – en säljare i världsklass? Fenix Projects söker Account Managers till vårt kontor vid Stureplan i Stockholm. Vi ser på försäljning som vilken elitidrott som helst och är du redo att satsa seriöst lovar vi att hjälpa till att utveckla dig till en av mediebranschens främsta säljare.**
**Fenix Projects grundades 2013 och är i dag ett av Nordens ledande bolag inom affärsutveckling och försäljning av media. Vår affärsidé är att ständigt utveckla, förbättra och introducera nya marknadsföringskoncept tillsammans med stora publicister som Dagens Nyheter och Dagens industri.**
**Vad vi förväntar oss av dig**
 Som Account Manager hos oss förväntas du inte bara göra snabba affärer utan också skapa långsiktiga hållbara samarbeten. Vi sätter kundens bästa i fokus och strävar alltid efter att erbjuda de mest attraktiva produkterna på marknaden.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Generös provisionsmodell: Vi erbjuder en fast marknadsmässig lön i kombination med en generös provisionsmodell. Vi tror på att premiera hög prestation och hårt arbete.
   

  

**Försäljning:** 
 Du kommer att erbjuda de mest innovativa medielösningarna som marknaden har att erbjuda. Vår produktportfölj består i dagsläget av innovativa och nytänkande lösningar inom digital native advertising och print.
   

  

**Teamet:** 
 Du får möjligheter att arbeta i ett team med några av Sveriges bästa mediesäljare, där vissa har över tio års erfarenhet inom framgångsrik försäljning och affärsutveckling inom media. Du är en teamplayer!
   

  

**En rolig arbetsplats:** 
 Vi värderar glädje på jobbet och arrangerar regelbundet olika aktiviteter, resor, tävlingar, after works, konferenser och temadagar. You name it.
   

  

**Personlig utveckling:** 
 Vi investerar i våra medarbetare och erbjuder flera utbildningsprogram samt regelbundna gästföreläsningar av Sveriges främsta experter inom försäljning, entreprenörskap och ledarskap.
   

  

**Spännande arbete i en växande organisation:** 
 Vi strävar efter att bli bäst inom varje område och erbjuder en platt organisation där du har möjlighet att bidra, växa och påverka bolagets utveckling.
   

  

**Karriärmöjligheter:** 
 Vi tror på individuell tillväxt och erbjuder dig möjligheter att forma din egen framtid hos oss. Det är du som bestämmer hur långt du vill gå, tex alla våra Sales Managers har börjat som Account Manager.
   

  

**Vi tycker det är ett plus om du har erfarenhet inom försäljning sedan tidigare men det är inget krav från vår sida. För oss är det viktigast att hitta dig som har talang och rätt attityd för att snabbt utvecklas i en högpresterande organisation.**
**Vi söker dig som**
* Är topp-presterare: Du ser dig själv som en topp-presterande individ, oavsett om det är inom arbetslivet, studier, idrott eller på annat sätt.
* Är resultatorienterad: Du är tävlingsinriktad och älskar att arbeta med tempo mot högt uppsatta mål.
* Är strukturerad: Du är punktlig och har självdisciplin. Det är avgörande för att navigera i en dynamisk säljmiljö.
* Är kommunikativ: Du kommer dagligen att interagera med beslutsfattare inom näringslivet. Det är viktigt att du kan uttrycka dig på ett välformulerat sätt, både i tal och skrift.


**Vill du bli bäst inom medieförsäljning och samtidigt forma din egen karriär, tveka inte att kontakta oss. Vi letar efter dig!**
 Är det något du undrar över så kontakta gärna
 *Johanna Brolin 0704654616,* 
*annars sök reda* 
*n idag då vi anställer så fort vi hittar rätt!*
***Hur är det att jobba på Fenix Projects? Läs artiklarna nedan!***

title: Account Manager
description:
Har du vad som krävs för att bli Fenix Campaigns nästa stjärnsäljare? Vi söker en Account Manager till vårt kontor på Stureplan. Är du redo att satsa på din karriär?
